articles.title: Greetings to President of Philippines
articles.content:
Greetings to President of Philippines
 Pyongyang, June 11 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Friday sent a message of greetings to Benigno Simeon Cojuangco Aquino, president of Philippines, on the occasion of the 113th anniversary of its independence.
					Believing that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would grow stronger, Kim in the message wished the President success in his work for achieving the stability and economic development of the country.

articles.title: Greetings to Foreign Minister of Philippines
articles.content:
Greetings to Foreign Minister of Philippines
 Pyongyang, June 11 (KCNA) -- Foreign Minister Pak Ui Chun Friday sent a message of greetings to Albert F. del Rosario, foreign minister of Philippines, on the occasion of the 113th anniversary of its independence.
					 The message expressed belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries developing on good terms in recent years would grow stronger in various fields and wished him success in his new job.

articles.title: Congratulations to Ugandan Foreign Minister
articles.content:
Congratulations to Ugandan Foreign Minister
 Pyongyang, June 11 (KCNA) -- Foreign Minister Pak Ui Chun Friday sent a congratulatory message to Sam Kutesa upon his reappointment as foreign minister of Uganda. 
					 Expressing belief that the traditional relations of friendship and cooperation between the two countries would continue to grow stronger in the future, the message wished him new success in his job.

articles.title: Kangso Mineral Water Increasingly Popular
articles.content:
Kangso Mineral Water Increasingly Popular 
 Pyongyang, June 11 (KCNA) -- Kangso Mineral Water is one of the most famous mineral waters in Korea.
					 The water has been popular for its medical effect from ancient times.
					
					 It, with mineral matters, hydrocarbon, calcium and magnesium ions, and many microelements, is efficacious for chronic gastritis hypoacida, arteriosclerosis, diabetes and other diseases.
					
					 The streamlined Kangso Mineral Water Factory produces hundreds of thousands of mineral water bottles every day.
					
					 There are many Kangso mineral water stands in Pyongyang.

articles.title: Cultural Relics in Mt. Kuwol
articles.content:
Cultural Relics in Mt. Kuwol
 Pyongyang, June 11 (KCNA) -- Many cultural relics and remains are well preserved in Mt. Kuwol, one of Korea's celebrated mountains.
					 Among them are a pavilion where Tangun, founder of Ancient Korea, studied and a site where he practised archery.
					
					 Jonggok Temple draws many tourists as it commands an excellent view.
					
					 On Sahwang Peak are remains of an old wall and a ruined celadon kiln belonging to the period of Koryo kingdom. 
					
					 Woljong Temple, made up of Myongbu Shrine, Suwol Hall and Manse Pavilion, nestles at the foot of Asa Peak.
					
					 Mt. Kuwol also has relics showing patriotic people's struggle against feudal rulers and fight against Japanese invaders in the late period of the Ri Dynasty.
					
					 The famous mountain is one of the country's major tourist resorts.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Calls for National Independence
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Calls for National Independence
						
 Pyongyang, June 11 (KCNA) -- It is 85 years since the Korean people waged the June 10 Independence Movement in massive protest against the Japanese imperialists' colonial rule. 
					 Rodong Sinmun Saturday devotes a by-lined article to this anniversary.
					
					 The movement was an eruption of the pent-up resentment and grudge of the Koreans against the colonial rule of the Japanese imperialists and a manifestation of their patriotic will to retake the usurped national sovereignty at the cost of blood, the article notes, and goes on:
					
					 Much water has flown under the bridge since the movement but south Korea is still under the foreign military occupation and domination. This deplorable reality clearly proves that national independence serves as a banner for the life and struggle of the Koreans.
					
					 The south Korea-Japan military nexus is being tightened as the days go by under the backstage wire-pulling of the U.S. and this is gravely threatening the peace on the Korean peninsula and escalating the inter-Korean confrontation.
					
					 The Lee Myung Bak group of traitors provoked the "Cheonan" and Yonphyong Island incidents, pushing the situation on the peninsula to a touch-and-go situation. Some days ago, it committed such most hideous provocation in history as hurting the supreme dignity of the DPRK.
					
					 National independence and dependence on outside forces can never go together.
					
					 If the traitors subservient to outside forces are allowed to remain within the nation, it is bound to suffer unimaginable disasters. The Korean people clearly experienced this through the distress-torn past.
					
					 The Lee Myung Bak group of traitors sold off the nation's interests to outside forces, kowtowing to its masters the U.S. and Japan, and is making desperate efforts to do harm to compatriots in league with them. The Korean nation can never achieve complete sovereignty as long as this group is allowed to stay in office.

articles.title: S. Korea's Total Drop of Their Policy of Confrontation with DPRK Demanded
articles.content:
S. Korea's Total Drop of Their Policy of Confrontation with DPRK Demanded
 Pyongyang, June 11 (KCNA) -- Members of civic and public organizations of south Korea held a press conference in Seoul on June 7 at which they demanded a drop of policy of confrontation with the DPRK.
					 Speakers at the press conference said that the recent disclosure of the secret contact made between the south and the north in Beijing brought to light that the Lee Myung Bak "government" is working hard to use the talks with the north for its political purpose.
					
					 The Lee "government" doesn't know about the north at all, they noted, strongly urging it to completely roll back the above-said policy and make a switchover to south-north reconciliation.
					
					 They demanded an immediate dismissal of Hyon In Thaek, minister of Unification, Kim Thae Hyo, presidential secretary for Foreign Strategy of the Chongwadae Secretariat, Chon Yong U, chief secretary for Diplomacy and Security of Chongwadae, and other ultra conservatives who are taking the lead in escalating confrontation with fellow countrymen.
					
					 The authorities should not disallow NGOs to participate in the event marking the 11th anniversary of the June 15 joint declaration to be held in Kaesong, they urged.
					
					 If the authorities stick to the above-said policy to the last, ignoring the demand of the people, they will surely face ruin, the speakers warned.
					
					 At the end of the press conference, they handed a written protest addressed to traitor Lee Myung Bak to Chongwadae.

articles.title: Prosecution's Suppression of Progressive Forces Slammed in S. Korea
articles.content:
Prosecution's Suppression of Progressive Forces Slammed in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, June 11 (KCNA) -- Civic and public organizations, including the Confederation of Trade Unions, and opposition parties of south Korea held a press conference in Seoul on June 7 demanding a stop to the suppression of the progressive forces.
					 Speakers at the conference said that the prosecution authorities have made investigation and searches into the confederation and its industrial trade unions from May on the suspicion that they offered aid funds to the progressive political parties.
					
					 This base action is aimed to obstruct the mega-merger of the progressive forces desired by the popular masses and put down the labor movement organizations, they pointed out.
					
					 The prosecution is getting hell-bent on the repression of the progressive forces only while turning aside the conservatives' offer of political aid funds to the "Grand National Party" and the irregularities and corruption by big businessmen and officeholders, they charged.
					
					 They stressed that the people from all walks of life would achieve the unity and solidarity of the progressive forces and certainly punish the vicious present "government" and the prosecution, its stooge.

articles.title: Actions for Terminating Dictatorial Rule Called for in S. Korea
articles.content:
Actions for Terminating Dictatorial Rule Called for in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, June 11 (KCNA) -- Members of the south Korean Council of Bereaved Families for the Nation and Democracy and students held a memorial service for martyr Ri Han Ryol at Yonsei University on June 9.
					 At the service speakers recalled that 24 years ago Ri Han Ryol, ex- student of Yonsei University, was killed by the tear gas fired by the police during the action for social democracy.
					
					 Achievements, though small, could be made in the movement for democratization of south Korea in the past thanks to such students as Ri, they noted.
					
					 Students are waging a dynamic struggle for a solution to the issue of registration fee, they said, calling for waging a more powerful struggle to put an end to the dictatorial rule of the present authorities.

articles.title: Candlelight Action of S. Korean Students' Unabated
articles.content:
Candlelight Action of S. Korean Students' Unabated 
 Pyongyang, June 11 (KCNA) -- An action of students under the south Korean Federation of University Students in the 21st Century was staged on Tuesday, too.
					 They held a candlelight rally at Chonggye Square in Seoul.
					
					 At the rally speakers denounced the authorities for suppressing the students demanding they implement the commitments to halve the registration fee.
					
					 What the students want is to settle the registration fee issue at an early date, they declared, urging the "Grand National Party" to clarify its stand on the issue.
					
					 The candlelight which had been held high against the import of American beef will rage higher to develop into a candlelight rally for the settlement of the registration fee issue and thus precipitate the ruin of Lee Myung Bak, they warned.
					
					 At the end of the rally the students staged a demonstration.
					
					 In another development, the general student councils of Korea University, Sogang University, Sookmyung Women's University and other universities held a press conference before Ehwa Woman's University at which they declared their students would stay away from classes on June 10 in demand of the settlement of the registration fee issue.
					
					 The Confederation of Trade Unions, the Citizens' Solidarity for Democratic Society and other civic and public organizations held an emergency meeting for measures together with students at which they declared that they would launch a joint struggle for the settlement of the registration fee issue.

articles.title: S. Korea's Hideous Provocation against DPRK Protested by IIJI Director General
articles.content:
S. Korea's Hideous Provocation against DPRK Protested by IIJI Director General
Pyongyang, June 11 (KCNA) -- Vishwanath, director general of the International Institute of the Juche Idea, issued a statement on June 7 in support of a statement released by a spokesman for the General Staff of the Korean People's Army which declared a thousand-fold retaliation against the hideous provocation of the Lee Myung Bak group of traitors.
					 The south Korean authorities recently committed such hideous hysteric provocation as letting military hooligans set up even targets hurting the supreme dignity of the DPRK at various drill grounds and fire at them, he said, and went on:
					
					 I join all the Korean people in expressing on behalf of the followers of the Juche idea all over the world the towering resentment at the unheard-of hysteria of the south Korean authorities against the DPRK.
					
					 The south Korean authorities should apologize to the Korean nation for this reckless act and give official firm assurances against the recurrence of the similar case.
					
					 They should behave themselves, bearing deep in mind that if they fail to do so, they will certainly face all-out military retaliatory actions of all the infuriated servicepersons and people of the DPRK and bitter denunciation by humankind.

articles.title: Statement of KPA General Staff Favored by Foreign Organizations
articles.content:
Statement of KPA General Staff Favored by Foreign Organizations
Pyongyang, June 11 (KCNA) -- The Swiss, British and French organizations expressed full support for the statement issued by a spokesman for the General Staff of the Korean People's Army. 
					The British Branch of the Korean Friendship Association in a statement on June 5 accused the south Korean puppet army of setting up a target and daring fire at it, a thrice-cursed criminal act of hurting the supreme dignity of the DPRK.
					
					Demanding the south Korean authorities make an immediate apology for their crimes, the statement fully supported the just stand clarified by the spokesman. 
					
					The Switzerland-Korea Committee and the Swiss Group for the Study of the Juche Idea in a joint statement on June 4 said that the provocation made by the south Korean puppet army is little short of a war declaration against all the Korean people.
					
					There is a limit to the patience on the part of the KPA and the Korean people, the statement said, adding that should a war break out on the Korean Peninsula, the south Korean warmongers will be held wholly accountable for it. 
					
					The France-Korea Friendship Association in a statement on June 4 accused the south Korean ultra-right conservative forces of doing harm to the supreme dignity of the DPRK and driving the inter-Korean relations into catastrophe.
					
					The statement called upon the world peace-loving forces to watch the present situation getting tenser on the peninsula once again and make every possible effort to defuse it.

articles.title: Lee Myung Bak Group's Confrontation with DPRK Flayed
articles.content:
Lee Myung Bak Group's Moves to Escalate Confrontation with DPRK Flayed
 Pyongyang, June 11 (KCNA) -- Jang Sun Jong, chairperson of the Central Association of Korean Nationals in Russia, issued a statement on June 7 in denunciation of the Lee Myung Bak group's moves to escalate the confrontation with the DPRK.
					 It went on:
					
					 The spokesmen for the DPRK National Defence Commission and the General Staff of the Korean People's Army issued statements in connection with the fact that the Lee group's moves to escalate the confrontation with the DPRK have reached an extreme phase.
					
					 As the statements pointed out, traitor Lee brought the inter-Korean relations to total collapse though they had favorably developed since the publication of the June 15 joint statement and is kicking up an unprecedentedly reckless confrontation racket against the DPRK, the statement noted, and continued:
					
					 The Lee group has cooked lies, whitewashed its misrule, hamstrung the efforts to achieve national reconciliation and unity and built artificial barriers in the way of peace and prosperity, driving the inter-Korean relations into an incontrollable catastrophe.
					
					 The Korean Peninsula can never be in peace even a moment and the improved inter-Korean relations are unthinkable as long as Lee keen to hurt compatriots, backed by the U.S., is allowed to stay in power. 
					
					 The only way out for the nation is to dethrone Lee Myung Bak. 
					
					 The association will conduct a dynamic struggle to judge the group of traitors.

articles.title: Anniversary of Kim Jong Il's Start of His Work at WPK Observed
articles.content:
Anniversary of Kim Jong Il's Start of His Work at WPK Observed
Pyongyang, June 11 (KCNA) -- Events were held in various countries from May 27 to June 2 to mark the 47th anniversary of General Secretary Kim Jong Il's start of his work at the C.C., the Workers' Party of Korea.
					They included a meeting, a photo exhibition and a film show in Bangladesh, a seminar in France, a lecture, a reading session and a film show in Ethiopia.
					
					 On display in the venues of the events were photos on his greatness and undying feats and other photos on the DPRK's might. 
					
					 The participants in the film shows watched Korean films "Fireworks for a Thriving Nation", "The Tower of the Juche Idea", "Reply of Korea" and others. 
					
					 The president of the Bangladesh People's League praised          Kim Jong Il as a peerlessly elder statesman who has led the WPK to one victory after another with matchless political caliber. 
					
					 The chief of the French Group for the Study of the Juche Idea and the Songun Idea spoke highly of Kim Jong Il who has turned the WPK into the most powerful one, a mass one enjoying absolute support and trust from the people and a mother party taking care of the fate of the people in a responsible manner. 
					
					 He stressed that the WPK would always emerge victorious in the future, too, thanks to the leadership of Kim Jong Il. 
					
					 The chief of a branch of the Ethiopian Youth Study Group of the Juche Idea arranged a reading session on Kim Jong Il's work "The Workers' Party of Korea Is the Party of the Great Leader Comrade Kim Il Sung" at which he said that the WPK has powerfully encouraged all the Korean people in socialist construction and positively mobilized the young people for it. 
					
					 A congratulatory message to Kim Jong Il was adopted at the seminar in France.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Feats Lauded by Foreign Media
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Feats Lauded by Foreign Media
						
Pyongyang, June 11 (KCNA) -- Newspapers of Bangladesh and Nepal each specially edited General Secretary Kim Jong Il's portraits and photographs and articles under various titles on the occasion of the 47th anniversary of his start of work at the C.C., the Workers' Party of Korea.
					 The Bangladeshi newspaper Blits on June 3 and 4 in articles titled "Kim Jong Il, our general", "Korea's feature" and "Deeply rooted Songun idea" said that Kim Jong Il is successfully carrying forward President Kim Il Sung's idea and cause. 
					
					 The newspaper stressed that Kim Jong Il further developed in depth  the Songun idea founded by the President as required by the developing reality, defending and glorifying the President’s Songun leadership feats. 
					
					 The Nepali newspaper Arpan on June 3 said that Kim Jong Il created many anecdotes about loving care for people true to the will of the President who believed in people as in Heaven for about 50 years since he started his work at the WPK Central Committee. It gave a detailed account of the fact that Kim Jong Il made sure that people was placed above anything in any case. 
					
					 A Guinean news agency on June 2 said that the DPRK's single-minded unity reached a high stage thanks to Kim Jong Il and the WPK has developed into a mighty mass party which formed a harmonious whole with the popular masses. 
					
					 On the same day, the domestic and international channels of the broadcasting service of Guinea and its seven national language broadcasting channel aired the similar program.

articles.title: Seminar on Greatness of Kim Il Sung Held
articles.content:
Seminar on Greatness of Kim Il Sung Held
 Pyongyang, June 11 (KCNA) -- A seminar on the greatness of President Kim Il Sung was held in Lahore, Pakistan on May 27.
					 Present there were personages of the National Workers' Party of Pakistan, the Pakistan Organization for Afro-Asian People's Solidarity, the Pakistan Trade Union Federation, the Pakistan Peasants Committee, the Lahore Branch of the Pakistan-Korea Friendship Association and the Pakistan Committee for Supporting Korea's Reunification and masses. 
					
					 Speeches were made by the chairman of the National Workers' Party of Pakistan and the ex-minister of Justice and the general secretary of the Lahore Branch of the Pakistan-Korea Friendship Association. 
					
					 Speakers praised the President for founding the immortal Juche idea and steadily developing it in depth, defeating U.S. and Japanese imperialisms in one generation and building the DPRK into an invincible power standing firm against any challenge of the imperialist powers. 
					
					 They expressed belief that the Korean people would surely achieve the independent and peaceful reunification of the country under the leadership of Kim Jong Il, creditably successor to the cause of the President. 
					
					 A letter to Kim Jong Il was adopted at the seminar.

articles.title: Festival of Koreans in Europe Held
articles.content:
Festival of Koreans in Europe Held
 Pyongyang, June 11 (KCNA) -- A festival of Koreans in Europe was held in Germany on June 4 to mark the 11th anniversary of the June 15 joint declaration.
					 Present there were members of the Overseas Side Committee, the European Regional Committee and the Canada Regional Committee for Implementing the June 15 Joint Declaration and Koreans in Germany, France, Denmark and other European countries.
					
					 Introduced at the festival were solidarity messages from the Overseas Side Committee and different regional committees for implementing the June 15 Joint Declaration, the Federation of Koreans in the U.S. and compatriots organizations in other parts of the world.
					
					 Then followed a lecture.
					
					 Lecturers said that the inter-Korean relations were brought to collapse and the danger of a war is increasing on the Korean Peninsula due to the Lee Myung Bak group.
					
					 They stressed the need to clear the dark clouds of a war at an early date and implement the joint declaration and thus achieve the independent and peaceful reunification of the country.
					
					 A resolution was adopted at the festival.
					
					 It underscored the need for all the overseas Koreans to intensify the struggle to implement the joint declaration under the banner of "By our nation itself".
					
					 An art performance was given to mark the anniversary.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung's Work Posted on Peruvian Internet Homepage
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung's Work Posted on Peruvian Internet Homepage
						
Pyongyang, June 11 (KCNA) -- The Peruvian-Korean Institute of Culture and Friendship posted on its Internet homepage the full text of President Kim Il Sung's work "Let Us Achieve the Great Unity of Our Nation" on June 6. 
					The work, published on August 1, Juche 80 (1991), clarifies the idea that the Korean nation is responsible for the country's reunification and indicates tasks for achieving the great unity of the entire nation and ways to do so.

articles.title: Chinese Minister of Agriculture on Prevention of Drought Damage
articles.content:
Chinese Minister of Agriculture on Prevention of Drought Damage
 Beijing, June 9 (KCNA) -- Chinese Minister of Agriculture Han Changfu at a meeting on June 5 called for prevention of drought damage under meticulous plan to ensure agricultural production.
					 Noting that now is the busy farming season during which tillering and heading of early rice and transplanting of seasonal rice are going in middle and lower Yangtze River areas, he stressed the need to pay attention to the impact on agricultural production by drought, confirm the area for rice cultivation and manure crops in a proper way.
					
					 He called for stepping up the plowing and rice transplantation across the country and planting other seeds in time in the paddy fields where rice-transplantation is impossible due to drought.

articles.title: Website on Party History Opens in China
articles.content:
Website on Party History Opens in China
						
 Beijing, June 9 (KCNA) -- China opened a website on the party history on June 8 on the occasion of the 90th anniversary of the Communist Party of China.
					 The website with 38 pages is supervised by the party history study room of the C.C., the CPC and will be used for research and study of the party history.

articles.title: Russian President Refers to Environment Protection
articles.content:
Russian President Refers to Environment Protection
 Moscow, June 9 (KCNA) -- Russian President Dmitri Medvedev in a conversation with environment experts on June 8 referred to the issue of environment protection.
					 There are a lot of problems to be settled in the field of environment in the country, he said, calling upon all the people to make efforts to this end.
					
					 He underscored the need to work out a law and regulations on environment protection as required by reality.

articles.title: Iranian President Clarifies His Stand Not to Stop Uranium Enrichment
articles.content:
Iranian President Clarifies His Stand Not to Stop Uranium Enrichment
						
 Tehran, June 9 (KCNA) -- Iranian President Mahmoud Ahmadinejad at a press conference on June 7 clarified the stand of his country not to stop the uranium enrichment.
					 He accused the West of ceaselessly putting pressure on his country under the pretext of the nuclear issue in a bid to disturb the development of Iran.
					
					 Iran will continue pushing forward its nuclear program, he stressed.

articles.title: Israeli Army Arrests Palestinians
articles.content:
Israeli Army Arrests Palestinians
 Pyongyang, June 11 (KCNA) -- The Israeli army is getting frantic with arrest of Palestinians despite the protest and denunciation of the international community.
					 12 Palestinians were arrested in the Israeli army's raids in most of the West Bank cities on Monday.

articles.title: US Attempt to Monopolize Network Space Accused
articles.content:
US Attempt to Monopolize Network Space Accused
						
 Beijing, June 9 (KCNA) -- The Chinese Liberation Army Daily on June 8 carried an article accusing the U.S. of attempting to monopolize network space.
					 In recent years the U.S. considered the network space as a new military area, talking about what it called "state security" and has worked hard to hold supremacy here, the paper said.
					
					 The U.S. is working out a strategy for cyber war, it said, adding that it would be nothing but a new excuse to use armed forces externally.

articles.title: US Drone Attack Kills 20 in Pakistan's Tribal Area
articles.content:
US Drone Attack Kills 20 in Pakistan's Tribal Area
						
 Pyongyang, June 11 (KCNA) -- The U.S. forces in Afghanistan are committing the killing of Palestinians under the pretext of "anti-terrorism".
					 At least 20 people were killed Wednesday when U.S. drones carried out a strike in an outskirt village of Miranshah, the main town of North Waziristan tribal area in northwest Pakistan.

articles.title: US Denounced for Seeking New Pretext for Use of Force
articles.content:
US Denounced for Seeking New Pretext for Use of Force
 Beijing, June 9 (KCNA) -- China's Liberation Army Daily on June 8 carried an article titled "U.S. seeks out new excuse for using arms externally". It said:
					 The U.S. Defense Department will make public its first cyber strategy in the foreseeable future.
					
					 The world fears that this strategy might give the U.S. forces an excuse for the external use of force.
					
					 In document "International strategy in the Network space" published on May 16 the U.S. said that it would relate the network freedom with its security and not rule out the use of force in case the cyber attack threatens the U.S. security.
					
					 In the new strategy the U.S. confirmed the possibility of the cyber attack being turned into a war action and granted the commanding officers the right to mount a retaliatory strike. This will, in fact, give adverse effect on the principle of law and the international relations as it implies the inclusion of the cyber attack in the definition of armed invasion.
					
					 A scrutiny into the U.S. Internet policy proves that it is consistent with the "double-dealing strategy" despite the change of expression. One part is that it would regard "Network freedom" as an important subsidiary means for conducting diplomacy worldwide and the other one is to contain rivals and ensure security under the pretext of "Network security." 
					
					 This strategy implies that other countries have to "open their Internet door" while the U.S. may close its Internet door the same way it strangled Wikileaks under the pretext of "safeguarding the state security."
					
					 This cyber strategy of the U.S. forces connoting this contradictory logic can not but be a new pretext for the external use of force.
					
					 In many cases the U.S. needs "pretexts", not truth for this purpose.
					
					 The lesson of the Iraqi war proves this.

articles.title: UN Human Rights Council Urges Abrogation of SL
articles.content:
UN Human Rights Council Urges Abrogation of SL 
						
Pyongyang, June 11 (KCNA) -- The 17th meeting of the UN Human Rights Council criticized on June 3 the suppression of the freedom of expression in south Korea. 
					A special rapporteur, when discussing a report on promoting the protection of freedom of expression, referred to his visit to south Korea last year. He deplored the reality in south Korea where a mere wrong use of a word or expression is liable to imprisonment though it professes "democracy" and "freedom." 
					
					He was stunned by the existence of a law which legalizes the violation of freedom of expression in south Korea.
					
					He urged south Korea not to incriminate the freedom of expression, ensure the freedom of assembly and repeal the "Security Law."
					
					Amnesty International expressed sympathy with the report and demanded an immediate repeal of the evil laws violating human rights.
					
					Representatives of various organizations in south Korea derided the "government" which harshly suppresses the freedom of expression while asserting that the freedom of expression and peaceful assembly is a "precondition for democracy."

articles.title: Cambodia's Rice Exports Grow Double in 4 Months
articles.content:
Cambodia's Rice Exports Grow Double in 4 Months 
 Pyongyang, June 11 (KCNA) -- Cambodia exported 42,669 tons of rice during the first four months of this year or an increase of double as against the same period last year, said the Ministry of Commerce on June 8.

articles.title: Cyber Crimes Rampant in UK
articles.content:
Cyber Crimes Rampant in UK
						
 Pyongyang, June 11 (KCNA) -- Cyber attacks are rampant in UK, raising a serious concern in the society.
					 The country suffered from more than 1,000 cyber attacks last year, said the secretary of State for Defence of UK on Tuesday.

articles.title: Volcano Brisk in Kamchatka, Russia
articles.content:
Volcano Brisk in Kamchatka, Russia
 Moscow, June 9 (KCNA) -- The Kizimen and Shebeluch volcanoes are brisk recently in Kamchatka, Russia.
					 Volcano ashes rose respective to 5.2 km and 7 km from the craters of the volcanoes on June 7.
					
					 An alarming signal was issued in this regard.

articles.title: Earthquake Hits China, Guatemala
articles.content:
Earthquake Hits China, Guatemala
 Pyongyang, June 11 (KCNA) -- A 5.3-magnitude earthquake hit a county of Xinjiang Uygur Autonomous Region, China on June 8. The epicenter was about 5 km deep in the earth of the county.
					 A 5.2-magnitude earthquake jolted Guatemala on June 7. Its epicenter was waters of the Pacific about 330 km west of Guatemala City.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il presencia la función de las familiares de oficiales del EPC
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il presencia la función de las familiares de oficiales del EPC
						
Pyongyang, 11 de junio (ATCC) -- El Dirigente Kim Jong Il, Secretario General del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, Presidente del Comité de Defensa Nacional de la República Popular Democrática de Corea y Comandante Supremo del Ejército Popular de Corea, presenció junto con los oficiales y soldados del EPC la función de los grupos artísticos de las esposas de oficiales de las Unidades 534, 529, 264 y 549 del EPC quienes participan en el cuarto concurso del segundo período de los grupos de ese tipo.
					En el repertorio de la ocasión estuvieron varias piezas de diferentes géneros como la canción acompañada de Oungum (instrumento musical de Corea) "Nostalgia", inmortal obra clásica, el acordeón y canción "Gloria a nuestro gran partido", la poesía en diálogo "El General y los familiares de militares", el solo "Mi esposo es oficial" y el coro "Marquemos el paso con el General".
					
					A través de la función de carácter revolucionario y combativo, las ejecutantes cantaron en tono patético la digna vida de sí mismas que están al frente de la defensa a ultranza al Líder como ayudantes a sus esposos en armas, y demostraron su fe y voluntad de dedicar toda la vida a la sagrada lucha por defender a la Dirección de la Revolución a costa de la vida y cumplir la causa revolucionaria del Juche.
					
					Muy satisfecho de que ellas hayan ofrecido esa magnífica función perfecta en lo ideo-artístico con excelentes piezas de gran valor cognoscitivo y educativo, el Dirigente expresó agradecimiento a ellas apreciando mucho sus éxitos logrados en la ocasión.
					
					Todas las piezas de la función plantearon seriamente los importantes problemas sociopolíticos, que se presentan en la lucha y la vida de los hombres de la época del Songun, a través de la vida esencial y significativa y en apego a las realidades y los aclararon profundamente en lo ideo-artístico, señaló y transmitió su cordial saludo a las ejecutantes vertiendo loas.
					
					En el curso de los concursos de grupos artísticos de las esposas de oficiales que tienen lugar anualmente, creció considerablemente la vocación cultural de ellas y se mejoró rápidamente el nivel de sus funciones artísticas, destacó y presentó las tareas programáticas que servirán de guía para dinamizar las actividades artísticas y culturales masivas.
					
					Le acompañaron en esta ocasión los cuadros directivos de los órganos del partido y las fuerzas armadas como Kim Jong Un, Ri Yong Ho, Kim Yong Chun, Kim Ki Nam, Choe Thae Bok, Jang Song Thaek, Kim Jong Gak, Kim Yong Il, Kim Yang Gon, Pak To Chun, Choe Ryong Hae, Thae Jong Su, Kim Phyong Hae, Mun Kyong Dok, Ju Kyu Chang, U Tong Chuk, Kim Chang Sop y Ri Myong Su, los miembros de la Comisión Militar Central del PTC, Kim Kyong Ok, Kim Myong Guk, Kim Won Hong y Yun Jong Rin, y el jefe de departamento del CDN, Hyon Chol Hae.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun conmemora 85º aniversario de una lucha antijaponesa
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun conmemora 85º aniversario de una lucha antijaponesa
						
Pyongyang, 11 de junio (ATCC) -- El diario Rodong Sinmun difundió en su edición de este sábado un artículo individual dedicado al 85º aniversario de la Manifestación Antijaponesa del 10 de Junio.
					Esta sublevación masiva fue la explosión de la indignación acumulada del pueblo coreano por la dominación colonial del imperialismo japonés y la expresión de su voluntad patriótica de rescatar con sangre la soberanía nacional arrebatada, comienza el artículo y prosigue:
					
					Aunque pasaron mucho tiempo desde entonces, la sociedad surcoreana sigue siendo ocupada y dominada por las tropas extranjeras. Esta realidad trágica muestra claramente que la independencia nacional debe ser hoy también la bandera de vida y lucha de la nación coreana.
					
					Se fortalece cada día más la colaboración militar entre el Sur de Corea y Japón bajo el control trasero de EE.UU., debido a lo cual se ve amenazada gravemente la paz de la Península Coreana y se exacerba la confrontación entre ambas partes coreanas. 
					
					La camarilla del traidor Lee Myung Bak llevó la situación de la Península Coreana a la crisis de guerra al inventar el incidente de hundimiento de la corbeta "Cheonan" y el de fuego artillero en la isla Yonphyong.
					
					Y hace poco, cometió una provocación cuya brutalidad no tiene precedentes en la historia insultando la máxima dignidad de la República Popular Democrática de Corea.
					
					Son incompatibles la independencia nacional y la dependencia de las fuerzas extranjeras.
					
					La nación coreana experimentó en su pasado martirizante que un vendepatria en el seno de sí misma causa tremendos desastres. 
					
					Mientras exista la camarilla del traidor Lee Myung Bak, que vende los intereses nacionales a las fuerzas extranjeras obedeciendo a ciegas a sus amos norteamericano y japonés y está desesperada para hacer daño a los connacionales, no se puede alcanzar nunca la independencia total de la nación coreana.

articles.title: China concentra la fuerza en la prevención de sequía
articles.content:
China concentra la fuerza en la prevención de sequía
						
Beijing, 9 de junio (ATCC) -- El ministro de Agricultura de China, Han Changfu, destacó en una reunión del día 5 la necesidad de asegurar la producción agrícola mediante la prevención de la sequía.
					En esta varada muy importante se realizan la ramificación y el espigueo de arroz temprano y el transplante de posturas de arroz estacional en las regiones de las corrientes media y abajo del río Yangtze, dijo y subrayó que en la rama agrícola deben prestar atención a los afectos de la sequía a la producción agrícola, definir el área de cultivo de arroz y abonar y cuidar bien los cultivos. 
					
					Además, en todas las localidades del país deben acelerar la arada de arrozales y el transplante de posturas de arroz, apuntó y agregó que en los arrozales imposibles de hacer el transplante por la sequía deben sembrar a tiempo otras semillas.

articles.title: Crecen las demandas del agua mineral de Kangso
articles.content:
Crecen las demandas del agua mineral de Kangso
Pyongyang, 11 de junio (ATCC) -- Entre las famosas aguas minerales de Corea sobresalen las muy refrescantes de Kangso.
					Sus propiedades como los minerales y los iones de hidrocarbonato, calcio, magnesio y muchos microelementos resultan muy efectivas en el tratamiento de enfermedades tales como la crónica gastritis hipoacidez, la arteriosclerosis y la diabetes.
					
					La Fábrica de Elaboración de Agua Mineral de Kangso, que tiene computarizados todos sus procesos productivos, cubre la creciente demanda del pueblo produciendo diariamente cientos de miles de botellas.
					
					Entre tanto, se llenan siempre de clientes los quioscos de aguas minerales de Kangso, distribuidos por toda esta capital.
